* Pitched a perfect game on May 18, 2004 }} 'Randall David "Randy" Johnson'
  (born September 10, 1963), nicknamed '"The Big Unit"', is a former American
  Major League Baseball left-handed pitcher. During a 22-year career, he pitched
  for six different teams.

The Johnson was celebrated for having one of the most dominant fastballs in the
game. He regularly approached, and occasionally exceeded, during his prime. He
also threw a hard, biting slider. Johnson won the Cy Young Award five times,
second only to Roger Clemens' seven.

Johnson finished his career first in strikeouts per nine innings pitched among
starting pitchers (10.67), second all-time in total strikeouts (4,875; first
among left-handed pitchers), third in hit batsmen (188), tenth in fewest hits
allowed per nine innings pitched (7.24), 22nd in wins (303), and 57th in
shutouts (37). He pitched two no-hitters, the second of which was the 17th
perfect game in baseball history.
categories: Major League Baseball pitchers who have pitched a perfect game
